subNodes.conversationText: root

Coming towards you along the path are a line of purple robed figures, about ten in number. Their robes are torn and dirty, and bound only with a thin rope. They do not seem to be paying much attention to the road ahead, and you doubt that they have spotten you yet.
Hide in the undergrowth and let them go past.
"Hide? From those scrawny purple chickens? I don't think so!"
"Dammit, Kangath!"

"It's too late now anyway. They've spotted us."

Judging by the sudden excitment amongst them, Kangath is right. The purple figures confer amongst themselves, and then scurry forward. You put your hand on your weapon, but it seems they want to talk with you rather than fight.
Stand your ground.

A pasty faced, whippet thin man steps forward. Under his torn purple cowl you see a pale, sharp face with piercing eyes.

"Who is the leader of your group?"
Continue.
"I am Kangath, the leader of this group. Who are you?"
"Hey! Hang on a minute, Kangath. I'm the leader of this group, not you."

Kangath turns to you in angry surprise, hand reaching instinctively for his axe.

"What? I am the strongest in the group; the clear leader! Do you dare challenge me?"
"Don't try my patience, Kangath! Get back in line!"

In the shadows behind Kangath, Mara slips her hand hand to the hilt of her blade and moves into striking distance.  

In front of you, the purple robed man's eyes widen, and he takes a couple of steps backwards. His hand reaches for a cruel looking mace hanging under the folds of his robes.

You are caught between them.
Continue

Kangath glares at you with red, angry eyes, fingering the hilt of his axe. Finally, he spits on the floor.

"I choose to get back in line, <FullName>. You may speak to these purple idiots. Do as you wish... this time."

Behind him, you see the clear relief on Mara's face as she relaxes the grip on her weapon.
Continue

The purple robed man has somewhat recovered his composure. The mace slips under his robe again, hidden from sight.

"Well, thank you. I didn't want to cause any bloodshed. My name is Augin, and I am one of the High Priests of Ettin. I am pleased to meet you on your journey."
"You are a priest of the Cult of Ettin?"
"Less of the Cult, please, if you will. We are not a cult. The Great Lord Ettin is a God like any other. We are his priests. We only look to bring release and comfort to the poor of Blackwinter."
Continue
"Don't trust these snakes, <FirstName>. They would burn Blackwinter alive. They are not to be trusted."
Continue

"She lies. Only those unwilling to accept the order would be cast into the fire."

"We don't want anything from you in any case. We are just passing on the road. I presume that you are not going to stop us from our travels?"
"Where exactly are you going?"
"I don't see how that is any of your concern. May we pass, or not?"
"Very well, we will leave you in peace."

Augin nods his thanks, and the purple figures move past you. You see that some of them are carrying heavy looking leather tombs, whilst others carry small urns that let of wisps of grey smoke. 

"Perhaps we will meet again," says Augin with a slight bow, and follows them.

You watch them until they disappear around a corner of the road, and then continue on your journey.
"Perhaps if you give me your gold and equipment, you may pass."
"I don't think so!" The thin man throws back his purple robe, and his hands blaze with a sudden power. "Bring the Fires down on them!"
Continue
"No, I can't let you spread your lies back in Blackwinter." [Attack them]
The thin man throws back his purple robe, and his hands blaze with a sudden power. "Bring the Fires down on them!"
Continue
"Very well, we will leave you in peace."

Augin nods his thanks and the purple figures move past you. You see that some of them are carrying heavy looking leather tombs, whilst others carry small urns that let of wisps of grey smoke. 

"Perhaps we will meet again," says Augin with a slight bow, and follows them.

You watch them until they disappear around a corner of the road, and then continue on your journey.
Continue
[Stay silent]

"You cannot lead if no one will follow you, Kangath! Get back in line!"

Mara has slipped her hand to her blade. Kangath lets out a low growl.
"Kangath. get back in line. Mara's right. I lead this group."

Kangath glares at you with red, angry eyes, fingering the hilt of his axe. Finally, he spits on the floor.

"I choose to get back in line, <FullName>. You may speak to these purple idiots. Do as you wish... this time."

Behind him, you see the clear relief on Mara's face as she relaxes the grip on her weapon.
[Stay silent]
"Excuse me. If I may interject? We only wish to pass by unmolested. I think we would rather deal with this one." He nods at you. "I get the impression we probably stand a better chance."
"What do you want?"

The purple robed man has somewhat recovered his composure. The mace slips under his robe again, hidden from sight.

"Well, thank you. I didn't want to cause any bloodshed. My name is Augin, and I am one of the High Priests of Ettin. I am pleased to meet you on your journey."
[Stay silent]
"You are not our leader, Kangath. <FirstName> is."
Continue

Kangath turns to you in angry surprise, hand reaching instinctively for his axe.

"What? I am the strongest in the group; the clear leader! Do you dare challenge me?"
Wait for them on the path.
The purple figures confer amongst themselves, and then scurry forward. You put your hand on your weapon, but it seems they want to talk with you rather than fight.
Continue
"Well, thank you. I didn't want to cause any bloodshed. My name is Augin, and I am one of the High Priests of Ettin. I am pleased to meet you on your journey."
"You are a priest of the Cult of Ettin?"
"Less of the Cult, please, if you will. We are not a cult. The Great Lord Ettin is a God like any other. We are his priests. We only look to bring release and comfort to the poor of Blackwinter."
Continue
"I have heard of this cult, <FirstName>. They want to bring down the established order and replace it with their own, twisted world. They would burn Blackwinter alive. They are not to be trusted."
Continue

"She lies. Only those unwilling to accept the order would be cast into the fire."

"We don't want anything from you in any case. We are just passing on the road. I presume that you are not going to stop us from our travels?"
"Where exactly are you going?"
"I don't see how that is any of your concern. May we pass, or not?"
"Very well."

Augin nods his thanks, and the purple figures move past you. You see that some of them are carrying heavy looking leather tombs, whilst others carry small urns that let of wisps of grey smoke. 

You watch them until they disappear around a corner of the road, and then continue on your journey.
"Perhaps if you give me your gold and equipment, you may pass."
"I don't think so!" The thin man throws back his purple robe, and his hands blaze with a sudden power. "Bring the Fires down on them!"
Continue
"No, I can't let you spread your lies back in Blackwinter." [Attack then]
The thin man throws back his purple robe, and his hands blaze with a sudden power. "Bring the Fires down on them!"
Continue
"Very well."

Augin nods his thanks, and the purple figures move past you. You see that some of them are carrying heavy looking leather tombs, whilst others carry small urns that let of wisps of grey smoke. 

You watch them until they disappear around a corner of the road, and then continue on your journey.
Continue
